alert.note: Alert for Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued February 28 at 5:23AM PST until March 02 at 8:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM WEDNESDAY TO 8 AM PST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 4 to 7 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands, Malibu Coast and Los Angeles County Beaches. * WHEN...From 1 AM Wednesday to 8 AM PST Thursday. * IMPACTS...There is an increased risk for ocean drowning. Rip currents can pull swimmers and surfers out to sea. Large breaking waves can cause injury, wash people off beaches and rocks, and capsize small boats near shore.
info.instruction: Remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions, or stay near occupied lifeguard towers. Stay of rock jetties, since they can be deadly locations in such conditions.

area.areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Beaches; Malibu Coast
